docs.snippet: In the early 1960's Leonel Brizola may have been Brazil's most dynamic populist figure--a one-time shoeshine boy who rose to phenomenal popularity through fiery rhetoric and such nationalist action as the expropriation of the I.T.T.-owned telephone...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the early 1960's Leonel Brizola may have been Brazil's most dynamic populist figure--a one-time shoeshine boy who rose to phenomenal popularity through fiery rhetoric and such nationalist action as the expropriation of the I.T.T.-owned telephone system in the State of Rio Grande do Sul, while he was its governor.
